SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
BoardModel
The BoardModel class represents the game board and the pieces in the game.
BoardModel.Color
Enum representing the color states of a game piece.
ConcurrentStack<T>
NOTE: THIS PIECE OF THE CODE IS BASED ON ONE OF THE TASKS GIVEN OUT ON THE COURSE WITH THE CODE OF BMEVIIIAB00 BY Budapest University of Technology and Economics A thread-safe stack implementation with additional features for game-specific use cases.
GameController
GameController manages the game logic, including piece placement, movement, and tracking player turns.
GameState
Represents the current state of the game.
InitAll
The `InitAll` class initializes and manages the main components of the game, including game screens, saved games, and map selection.
InitGameScreen
Initializes the game screen with a graphical user interface for the board and menu.
InitGameScreen.IntTuple
Custom class for representing a pair of integer coordinates (x, y).
InitGameScreen.Line
Custom class for representing a line segment defined by two points (x1, y1) and (x2, y2).
InitGUI
Represents the initial graphical user interface (GUI) for the game.
MapModel
Represents the model of a game map, including locations, lines, groups, and associated data.
MillGame
 
TopList
Represents a top list for storing and managing players and their scores.
TopList.Player
Represents an individual player with a name and score.
